alert.note: Alert for Jackson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:43PM EDT until May 26 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Jackson County in western North Carolina... * Until 1100 PM EDT. * At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Jackson county. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly over localized areas. The Tuckasegee river in Cullowhee is currently at 13.4 feet and rising quickly. Flood stage is 16.0 feet. An area of particular concern is the confluence of the east and west forks of the Tuckasegee river where flooding could develop quickly and adversely affect East Fork Road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sylva, Cherokee, Cullowhee, Highlands, Balsam, Webster, Dillsboro, Cashiers, Lake Glenville, B.R. Parkway-Balsam Gap To Black Balsam Area, B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Black Balsam Area, Tuckasegee, Savannah, Whiteside Mountain and Whittier. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
